info.name: Corticospinal tract
info.description: The corticospinal tract is a descending pathway (of Upper Motor Neurons) that originates in the cerebral cortex, travels through the posterior limb of the internal capsule, basis pedunculi of the midbrain, basilar pons, the pyramid of the medulla and then decussates at the medulla/spinal cord junction. Upon entering the spinal cord, the majority of the tract travels in the lateral funiculus of the spinal cord with its fibers terminating along the length of the cord on both motor and sensory neurons. Its fibers and their cells of origin are considered to be Upper Motor Neurons. This is the primary pathway that deals with skilled voluntary movements.
info.item: /Sections/Thin, Whole Brain/Sagittal & Parasagittal/3 Sag Thin Sec
